examples: I absolutely love your shoes.
The cranberry pie at the bakery is absolutely delicious, especially with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
Jenny is absolutely cheesed off with her job.
He was said to be absolutely shattered after losing his job.
Those of you with clear consciences have absolutely nothing to fear.
words.defineEn: used to show complete agreement
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để hiển thị hoàn toàn đồng ý

examples: And it and the attorney general from Texas’s threat and a lot of other things lead to the president acceding, I guess, letting Sessions make the announcement, but being himself vulnerable, I suppose, to a campaign to make him look like a bad guy.
words.defineEn: to agree to something such as a request, demand, etc.
words.defineVi: để đồng ý với một cái gì đó như một yêu cầu, nhu cầu, vv

examples: You have to accept the ebb and flow of love in a relationship.
Finally, the mayor had to accept that a dead bee makes no honey.
She had to accept defeat without losing face.
Put simply, we accept their offer or go bankrupt.
Take time by the forelock and accept that fantastic internship!
words.defineEn: to say yes to what is asked of you or offered to you
words.defineVi: nói có với những gì được yêu cầu của bạn hoặc cung cấp cho bạn

examples: Still can't get over the idea that someone thought bullying real life children was an acceptable thing to do.
Pre-loaded bloatware looks pretty acceptable.
That's acceptable.
That's acceptable.
that's totally acceptable.
words.defineEn: agreed on by most people in a society
words.defineVi: được hầu hết mọi người trong xã hội đồng ý

words.defineEn: in a manner that is satisfactory or good enough
words.defineVi: một cách thỏa đáng hoặc đủ tốt

examples: John's family disowned him when they discovered he was born on the wrong side of the blanket, but he found solace and acceptance among friends who appreciated him for who he was.
The teacher told her students that it takes all sorts to make a world in an effort to promote acceptance and understanding of different personalities and backgrounds.
Those who are different or unconventional may struggle to gain acceptance in some groups or cultures - the nail that sticks out, gets hammered down.
A theory's acceptance, however, is often gladiatorial.
And part of this acceptance is also grieving the loss of your childhood.
words.defineEn: the act of agreeing with a belief, idea, statement, etc.
words.defineVi: hành động đồng ý với một niềm tin, ý tưởng, tuyên bố, vv

examples: The human resources manager understood that her employees had varying needs and preferences, and created a flexible work environment to accommodate them - different strokes for different folks.
I can't accommodate them all.
Now, it will accommodate a new wave of refugees escaping Turkey’s attack on northeast Syria.
Part of this involved the shuffling around of the modules that made up Mir, to accommodate the arrival of Atlantis.
So, we're getting a lot more doses of the vaccine next week to accommodate that population.
words.defineEn: to accept someone's opinion and consider doing it, particularly when it differs from one's opinion
words.defineVi: chấp nhận ý kiến của ai đó và cân nhắc thực hiện nó, đặc biệt khi ý kiến đó khác với ý kiến của một người

examples: Northern Ireland's peace accord featured during yesterday's discussions between President Biden and Britain's Prime Minister Boris Johnson.
He pulled out of the Paris climate accords.
He felt a real responsibility to Rabin, a personal responsibility to see through his legacy, and the Oslo accords was Rabin's legacy.
He won for the first time in 1996, in part by opposing the Oslo accords and their nascent steps toward peace.
The Israeli government claims that, according to the 1993 Oslo peace accords, the Palestinian Authority is responsible for West Bank and Gaza public health.
words.defineEn: an official agreement between two countries or groups of people
words.defineVi: một thỏa thuận chính thức giữa hai quốc gia hoặc nhóm người

words.defineEn: a finalized agreement
words.defineVi: một thỏa thuận cuối cùng

examples: - So affirmative action has a really long history.
The debate over affirmative action has been raging for years.
- Affirmative action is not what is causing Asian Americans not to get in to schools.
And to be clear, affirmative action isn't always about race.
Affirmative action advocates also point out that a more diverse campus benefits everyone, not just the students it's specifically designed to help.
words.defineEn: a statement or gesture indicating approval
words.defineVi: một tuyên bố hoặc cử chỉ cho thấy sự chấp thuận

examples: - So affirmative action has a really long history.
The debate over affirmative action has been raging for years.
- Affirmative action is not what is causing Asian Americans not to get in to schools.
And to be clear, affirmative action isn't always about race.
Affirmative action advocates also point out that a more diverse campus benefits everyone, not just the students it's specifically designed to help.
words.defineEn: showing agreement or approval
words.defineVi: thể hiện sự đồng ý hoặc phê duyệt

examples: And you have got to affirmatively try to get different people in the same room.
But you would say clearly and affirmatively that democratic socialism as enunciated by somebody like Bernie Sanders or AOC is just flat wrong.
And time after time after time it’s incumbent upon my clients to affirmatively step forward and say you can’t charge me these fees because you missed your deadline.

But as far as I understand the statute and the recent decision in CREW there’s nothing that requires an agency to affirmatively state or to affirmatively address the fee assessment slash deadline compliance issue in its response, in its final decision.
It’s been many years since the 2007 amendments went in place and I have yet to see an agency affirmatively state
words.defineEn: in a way that shows agreement or approval
words.defineVi: theo cách thể hiện sự đồng ý hoặc chấp thuận

examples: The board agreed to sell the company.
All ministers are agreed on the need to cut bureaucratic red tape.
Do you agree that the opposite side of the coin is too often untold?
The deal will be agreed on Wednesday, knock on wood.
Getting off his back would be nice for a change don't you agree?
words.defineEn: to hold the same opinion about something as that of another person
words.defineVi: để giữ quan điểm tương tự về một cái gì đó như của người khác

words.defineEn: having the same opinion about something
words.defineVi: có cùng quan điểm về một cái gì đó

examples: The agreement followed months of negotiation.
The agreement came after several hours of negotiations.
The negotiations between the two countries finally yielded a peace agreement.
The agreement is part of efforts to bring peace to the region.
She nodded in agreement with his statement.
words.defineEn: a promise, an arrangement, or a contract between two or more people
words.defineVi: một lời hứa, một sự sắp xếp, hoặc một hợp đồng giữa hai hoặc nhiều người

words.phonetic: tʊ ɐɡɹiː tə dɪsɐɡɹiː slæʃ dɪfɚ
words.defineEn: to stop arguing with someone upon accepting the fact that both have different opinions about something
words.defineVi: ngừng tranh cãi với ai đó khi chấp nhận sự thật rằng cả hai đều có ý kiến khác nhau về điều gì đó

examples: But if you want to find true fulfillment, it's important to choose a path that aligns with your values and interests.
When their schedules didn't align, the couple made a conscious effort to make time for each other.
Despite the offer of a generous salary, John turned his nose up at the job offer because it didn't align with his career goals.
The locations of the cases aligned almost perfectly with the range of a specific type of tick, the lone star tick.
So it aligns with your stud.
words.defineEn: to agree with a group, idea, person, or organization and support it
words.defineVi: để đồng ý với một nhóm, ý tưởng, người, hoặc tổ chức và hỗ trợ nó

examples: With the signing of the treaty, a powerful new European alliance first saw the light of day.
In politics, it's often true that the enemy of your enemy is your friend, and we see strange alliances formed for short-term gain.

The politician made a point of showing respect and kindness to his opponents, believing that it is good to make a bridge of gold to a flying enemy, and that treating people well could help him build alliances and get things done.
He wanted an alliance.
We witnessed an alliance between an elected head of state and a violent extremist organization on full display.
words.defineEn: an association between countries, organizations, political parties, etc. in order to achieve common interests
words.defineVi: sự liên kết giữa các quốc gia, tổ chức, đảng phái chính trị, v.v. nhằm đạt được lợi ích chung

examples: Wow, all his geese are swans, all right!

words.defineEn: a word used to show that we agree
words.defineVi: một từ được sử dụng để cho thấy rằng chúng tôi đồng ý

examples: Was Allies on to something?
- You hate cats, Ally. -

words.defineEn: to support or side with another
words.defineVi: để hỗ trợ hoặc đứng về phía người khác

examples: Schools have welcomed such arrangements with open arms.

When dealing with important financial arrangements, it is imperative that you do not count your chickens before they are hatched.
He decided to voice his concerns and was able to negotiate a better work arrangement.
words.defineEn: an agreement made with someone
words.defineVi: một thỏa thuận được thực hiện với một ai đó

examples: Given the sometimes anodyne statements that you see inside Hallmark greeting cards, to come out so eloquently and so pointedly against the administration, I thought was very courageous.
words.defineEn: not likely to offend people or cause disagreement or tension

words.defineEn: official approval or agreement
words.defineVi: phê duyệt hoặc thỏa thuận chính thức

examples: The proposal has won the approval of the city council.

It's important to have confidence in your own abilities and worth, and not rely on the approval of others, as a nod from a lord is a breakfast for a fool.
words.defineEn: a formal agreement to something
words.defineVi: một thỏa thuận chính thức cho một cái gì đó

examples: Flying in the face of public opinion, the local authority has approved the demolition of the old theatre.
He didn't approve of the plan and said so in as many words.
In February of 1867, the government approved Roebling’s proposal.
Your brain on love is scientifically approved.
Earlier, the Israeli defense minister approved the call-up of 9,000 more reservists.
words.defineEn: to officially agree to a plan, proposal, etc.
words.defineVi: để chính thức đồng ý với một kế hoạch, đề xuất, vv

examples: He has obstructed the administration of justice by refusing his assent to laws for establishing judiciary powers.
He has refused his assent to laws, the most wholesome and necessary for the public good.
- he has obstructed the ADMINISTRATION of justice, by refusing his assent to laws for Establishing Judiciary Powers.
He has forbidden his governors to pass laws of immediate and pressing importance, unless suspended in their operation until his assent should be obtained.
I think he knew, when he essentially gave his unenthusiastic assent to Pelosi and Reid to go ahead and let’s get this done, he was doing what McCain often talked about.
words.defineEn: approval of or agreement to something from someone in authority
words.defineVi: phê duyệt hoặc đồng ý với một cái gì đó từ một người nào đó trong cơ quan

examples: He has obstructed the administration of justice by refusing his assent to laws for establishing judiciary powers.
He has refused his assent to laws, the most wholesome and necessary for the public good.
- he has obstructed the ADMINISTRATION of justice, by refusing his assent to laws for Establishing Judiciary Powers.
He has forbidden his governors to pass laws of immediate and pressing importance, unless suspended in their operation until his assent should be obtained.
I think he knew, when he essentially gave his unenthusiastic assent to Pelosi and Reid to go ahead and let’s get this done, he was doing what McCain often talked about.
words.defineEn: to agree to something, such as a suggestion, request, etc.

examples: Myths from other parts of eastern Asia also associate dragons with water and imperial power.
Astronomers usually associate those conditions with the space around a black hole.

words.defineVi: hoàn toàn đồng ý với ai đó hoặc cái gì đó

examples: This kind of corporate buy-in is ultimately necessary for a carbon-free future.
